Las Vegas STD Testing Needed: Clark County Account for Most STD Infections in Nevada

Posted by admin on December 16th, 2011

Las Vegas STD testing is good idea for residents and visitors of Sin City. After all, remember that fatherly advice from The Hangover: “What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas—except for herpes. That $#!% comes back with you.”

Jokes aside, STDs are no laughing matter. When left undetected, these infections can cause serious complication such as infertility. Las Vegas STD testing is recommended for anyone who is sexually active at least once a year. Here are some statistics which show the need for STD testing in Las Vegas:

Las Vegas STD Statistics

  • 81% of chlamydia cases in Nevada were diagnosed in Clark County (2009). STD testing in Las Vegas for women should include chlamydia and gonorrhea since both can cause infertility.
  • 90% of gonorrhea infections in Nevada were found in Clark County (2009). A Las Vegas STD test for gonorrhea uses a painless urine sample.
  • Clark County accounts for 95% of syphilis infections in Nevada (2009). A syphilis test is recommended for high-risk groups such as African Americans and men who have sex with men.
  • 6,692 people living with HIV in the state of Nevada (2008). HIV testing in Las Vegas should be performed at least annually for anyone who is sexually active.

It’s important to note that STD screening in Las Vegas should take place even when symptoms aren’t present since most STDs have no noticeable signs. Fortunately, it’s never been easier to check for STDs in Las Vegas. STD testing in Las Vegas is available at dozens of facilities throughout the area. STD tests in Las Vegas take less than 20 minutes and appointments are never required. Don’t wait another day—test today!
